results.title: ASHE: the way of life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Colin Colger
results.brief_description: After the death of his mother and losing his way to a life of crime, Colin, a sports loving Shepparton boy, was offered a new beginning - a lifeline - through ASHE (Academy of Health Sports and Education).

results.title: Jim Serafim goes to School
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A Greek child’s first day at school. Demonstrates the difficulties non-English speaking children and their parents have in their “new” country.

results.title: Betty: a shop steward
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Betty, from a Scottish working-class background, is a shop steward who plays a strong role in improving conditions at the factory in which she works. Intended to look critically and personally at the stereotype of the “pommy troublemaker” unionist, the film also raises other questions about working women.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Discussion highlights a young Yugoslav girl’s desire to become Australian in order to gain acceptance and combat prejudice. By contrast, her Australian friend endorses the continuance of ethnic identity and customs and extols the virtues of a multicultural society.
results.title_for_label: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia

results.title: Mick: revisited
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Second part of a longitudinal study of Mick, an adolescent from Sydney’s western suburbs. Looks at the effects that the first film, made two years earlier, had on him and explores his attitudes towards his ethnic background. (See the first part “Mick” (Title code 012708).

results.title: Ana: an interpreter
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Ana is a Spanish/English interpreter in a Sydney family centre. The film shows some of the problems with which she works - human rather than linguistic ones - and her relationships with English-speaking co-workers. The film is designed to raise questions about the need for communicators like Ana and about the isolation of non-English speaking people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:

results.title: Margaret: a pride in identity
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Margaret is an urban aboriginal woman who became involved in the pre-school Murawina, first as a mother then later as a trainee pre-school teacher. Margaret is shown at home with her white Australian husband and at work. The film stresses the importance of Aboriginal identity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.

results.title: Kemal: a Turkish boy
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Kemal is a Turkish-born youth at school in Sydney. He has been in Australia for two years. The film shows the difficulties he experiences, particularly as they relate to language. It also illustrates the cultural background of a child from Turkey which has a strong male-oriented order and where the Islam religion is dominant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Blagg, Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: Leong, Angela: a cultural transition
results.creator_credit: Tony Wheeler, Jan Sharp, Film Australia and R P Birch and Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Leong, a Malaysian born Chinese, and Angela, an Australian born Chinese, both talk about their attitudes towards being assimilated into Australian society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Wheeler, Jan Sharp, Film Australia and R P Birch and Associates

results.title: Sue and Mario: the Italian Australians
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
An introduction to the hybrid lifestyles resulting from the marriage of two second-generation Australians of different ethnic origins. Both Sue and Mario are second generation Australians. Sue’s family migrated from England, whilst Mario’s came from Italy. The couple live in Griffith, a N.S.W. rural community where more than fifty per cent of the population is of Italian descent. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
